alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 1:24PM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT/11 PM PDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Idaho and northeast Oregon, including the following areas, in Idaho, Boise Mountains, Camas Prairie, Upper Weiser River and West Central Mountains. In northeast Oregon, Baker County. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT/11 PM PDT/ tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong upper level trough has moved into the area today, promoting the development of strong thunderstorms with heavy rain. Thunderstorms will be capable of torrential rainfall, small hail, and gusty winds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
